text: Charles Delafaye (1677 - 11 December 1762) was Member of the Parliament of Ireland for Belturbet from 1715 to 1727Search Ulster Historical Foundation - Biographies of Members of the Irish Parliament 1692-1800 and Chief Secretary to the Earl of Galway and the Duke of Grafton who held joint Governorship. Delafaye shared his that role with Martin Bladen. He was elected a Fellow of the Royal Society in 1725. He was appointed a Clerk of the Signet from 1728 to 1747. He died in 1762 at the age of 85 at his home in Wichbury, near Salisbury. ==References== Category:1677 births Category:1762 deaths Category:Chief Secretaries for Ireland Category:Irish MPs 1715–1727 Category:Members of the Privy Council of Ireland Category:Fellows of the Royal Society Category:Members of the Parliament of Ireland (pre-1801) for County Cavan constituencies Category:Freemasons of the Premier Grand Lodge of England
title: Charles Delafaye
